guide.introduction: Want to make an even more compact, pocket-size foosball game? Here’s how.
guide.introduction_rendered:
Want to make an even more compact, pocket-size foosball game? Here’s how.

Relevant parts
  • Paper clips
  • Paper clip box
  • Gumball
  • Tape
Tools
  • Scissors

lines.text: Straighten 4 paper clips and bend them into the shape as shown, being sure to include a “V” near the center to act as a game paddle.
lines.text_raw: Straighten 4 paper clips and bend them into the shape as shown, being sure to include a “V” near the center to act as a game paddle.

lines.text: Notice the “hook” on alternating ends of each paper clip — this will prevent the paper clip paddles from sliding out of the paper clip guides.
lines.text_raw: Notice the “hook” on alternating ends of each paper clip — this will prevent the paper clip paddles from sliding out of the paper clip guides.

lines.text: Wrap some tape at the non-hook ends of each paddle to act as handle grips for each player.
lines.text_raw: Wrap some tape at the non-hook ends of each paddle to act as handle grips for each player.

lines.text: Cut off the top flap of the paper clip box, and cut away a square section at each end of the box for the ball to eject.
lines.text_raw: Cut off the top flap of the paper clip box, and cut away a square section at each end of the box for the ball to eject.

lines.text: Slide 8 paperclips onto the long sides of the box, 4 per side, evenly spaced.
lines.text_raw: Slide 8 paperclips onto the long sides of the box, 4 per side, evenly spaced.

lines.text: Slide the 4 paper clip paddle arms into the paper clip guides on each side.
lines.text_raw: Slide the 4 paper clip paddle arms into the paper clip guides on each side.

lines.text: Toss the candy ball on the micro game board, and you’re ready to play.
lines.text_raw: Toss the candy ball on the micro game board, and you’re ready to play.

guide.title: Micro Foosball Game
